article.headline: Mercer 82, Stetson 81
article.story: DELAND, Fla. (AP) -- Mercer's Will Emerson scored 14 points, his last two coming on the Bears' final basket in overtime, leading his team to an 82-81 victory over Stetson Tuesday. Emerson had four of Mercer's six points in OT with the other basket coming on a foul-line jumper by senior guard Andrew Brown, who finished with 12 points. Junior guard Ross Alacqua led the Bears with 18 points. Stetson didn't score from the floor in overtime. However, the Hatters made all their OT points from the foul line, connecting on five of eight. Stetson senior guard Anthony Register made two free throws to tie the game at 80 with 1:20 to play. Register had a game-high 27 points, but missed another opportunity to tie the game with 44.5 seconds to play when he missed the first of two free throws. The Hatters had a chance to win the game after freshman forward Eric Diaz pulled down a defensive rebound with 9.5 seconds left. Stetson pushed the ball down court before Diaz tried to draw a foul in the lane and followed that missed shot with a tip that rolled off the rim as time expired. Mercer (4-12, 3-7) snapped a five-game losing streak. Stetson lost its sixth straight, and fell to 2-16 overall and 2-8 in conference.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
